summary: Greek mythology is the collection of stories told by ancient Greeks about their gods, heroes, and mythical creatures. These tales explain the world's beginnings, the gods' lives, and important Greek rituals. They were first shared through songs and poems, with famous works like Homer's *Iliad* and *Odyssey*, and Hesiod's *Theogony*. These stories were also shown in art on vases and other objects. Greek mythology has greatly influenced Western culture and is still important in our language and arts today.
title: Greek mythology
